lines.content: about: Create a bug report for the GiftForGood website
Before opening a new issue, please search existing issues:  https://github.com/GiftForGood/website/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Ac.Bug
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
Steps to reproduce the behavior, please provide code snippets or a repository:
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
Add any other context about the problem here.
about: Create a feature request for the GiftForGood website
Before opening a new issue, please search existing issues:  https://github.com/GiftForGood/website/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Ac.Feature
## Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.
A clear and concise description of what you want and what your use case is.
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen.
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.
Add any other context or screenshots about the feature request here.
about: Ask us any further questions about the GiftForGood website
Before opening a new issue, please search existing issues:  https://github.com/GiftForGood/website/issues?q=is%3Aissue+label%3Ac.Question
## Describe your question, provide as much detail as possible.
A clear and concise question of what you want to know.
about: Provide user stories for our GiftForGood website
## Describe the user story in detail.
As a {user type / role}, I can {function} so that {benefit}...

Giftforgood is your friendly neighborhood in-kind donations platform.
Run `npm install` in the root directory to install all the relevant dependencies such as React, Next.js etc.
In the project directory, you can run:
Runs the app in the development mode.
Open [http://localhost:3000](http://localhost:3000) to view it in the browser.
Hot reloading is available in this mode, i.e. the page will reload if you make edits.
You will also see any lint errors in the console.

import { Badge, Stack, Text, Heading } from '@kiwicom/orbit-components/lib';
import { donor as donorType, npo as npoType } from '@constants/userType';
const DonationPage = ({ donationId, donationDetails, donorDetails, user, prevHref, categoryName }) => {
const loginUserType = user == null ? '' : user.user.donor ? donorType : npoType;
Your chat will be private between yourself and the opposite party.
const question = 'Will I be notified of any new chat messages?';
Yes. You will receive an email notification for new unread messages.
const question = 'Can I drop off donated items?';
Yes. Before dropping off your items, please check with the NPO on the centre address, opening hours and
whether there is space to hold your donated items.
Please check with the NPO to confirm the delivery arrangement. Depending on the confidentiality of
beneficiaries' addresses, some NPOs would prefer to arrange the delivery. In cases where NPOs obtain consent
from beneficiaries to share their addresses, NPOs may require your assistance to arrange for delivery instead.
const question = 'Who will pay for deliveries of the items?';
- We encourage donors to pay for the deliveries through our user education efforts. For example, when donors

create a post, we have a banner prompting donors to sponsor the delivery of their donations.
- We have
partnered with GOGOX and Red Sun Movers to provide subsidised delivery rates for in-kind donations facilitated

via GfG
- However, if you (as the donor) are unable to cover the delivery costs, do inform the NPOs to
const question = 'Who will receive the delivery?';
The delivery will be either received by the NPO or directly to the beneficiary. This will be up to each
• Post the items that you would like to donate.
• Browse through NPO wishes to find any similar wishes.
• Chat with NPOs to confirm donation details.
• Please chat with NPOs first to confirm your donation, before dropping off/delivering any items.
If your item is not found on Wishes page, please be patient and wait for NPOs to respond to your listings.
For more information, please read through FAQs or contact{' '}
const question = 'Can I complete the wish?';
You can only complete your own “Wishes” post. We recommend that you complete your “Wishes” post after you or
your client has received the item from the donor. The complete button can be found in the top right corner of
const question = 'Can I delete my post history?';
No, you cannot delete your post history.
const question = 'Can I edit my completed posts?';
No, you cannot edit your completed post.
const question = 'Can I share the address of the beneficiary with the donor?';
If the PDPA guidelines of your organisation allows, you are free to share your address with the donor so that
const question = 'How long will my post stay up on the “Wishes” or Donations” page?';
- For wishes, your post will only be up for 4 weeks, after which you can still see your post on your profile
page but not on the main Wishes page.
- For donations, posts on the donation page will be up for the valid period specified when creating the
const question = 'How do I check whether my posts are still live?';
View your profile to check the status of your post. If it is “Ongoing”, your post is still live. If it is
“Completed” or “Closed”, it is no longer live.
const question = 'How do I edit my active posts?';
Please click into your post. Beside your profile name, you will find a “three vertical dots” button which you
can click on. You may then click on “edit post”.
const question = 'How do I post wishes/donations?';

- Click on the red “Post” button on the top right.
- Fill up the details of your request.
const question = 'How should I list large quantities of items?';
- For wishes, we recommend creating one post per item. You may state the quantity of items you need within the
description. You only need to complete the post after all quantities of the item have been fulfilled.
- For Donations, add the quantity amount in either the title or description below.
const question = 'What should I write in my “Wishes” post description?';

- For example your title can be “Biscuits”
- In the description you can state that you want the biscuits
- If you aren’t sure what details you need to include, we have included a few tips at the bottom to
guide you in “How you can write better”
const question = 'Are there any limits to the number of posts?';
There is currently no limit to the number of posts, but keep in mind that your post will only be up for 4
const question = 'Can I reopen my expired posts?';
If your request is still ongoing after 4 weeks and you still need the item, you can go on to your profile and
const question = 'What can I donate on GfG?';
GfG allows in-kind donations of various items listed below (based on categories)
const question = 'What can I request for on GfG?';
Items that you require for your organisation/clients’ needs e.g food, clothing, furniture, electronics.
const question = 'Which location should I use in my “Wishes” post?';
We recommend you to use the address of your centre. We strongly advise against listing your beneficiaries’
address here. You may inform donors of the beneficiary’s addresses at their consent in a private message.
const question = 'Where can I find the item listing by donors?';
- Using the search bar on top, you can change the dropdown button to “Donations” and searching for items.{' '}

const question = 'Where can I view my post history?';
Click on the profile icon on the top right to view your profile and all your posts, including ongoing,
const question = 'Can I edit my organisational information?';
NPO users are currently not able to edit their organisational information. Please write in to
partnerships@giftforgood.io with your proposed edits and we will reply within 3 business days.
const question = 'If I am interested in being a corporate donor, how can I help?';
If you wish to be a corporate donor, do contact us via partnerships@giftforgood.io and we will reply within 3
const question = 'How do I update my profile?';
You may click on your profile picture, “view profile” and the button “edit profile”.
Once you have registered for an account, the admins will verify your account and you will receive a
const question = 'How do I register for a donor account?';
In order to register for a donor account, click ‘Register’ via the https://www.giftforgood.io/ website and
sign up now. You can either sign up using your google email or any other email to be a donor.{' '}
const question = 'How do I register for a NPO account?';
Click on the ‘Register’ button on the top right and Sign up for an NPO account. You may then fill in the
details of your organisation and we will verify your account. Once you have received a confirmation email,
your account is ready for use.
const question = 'Who can register for a donor account?';
Anyone can register for a donor account as long as you are interested in donating items to NPOs in Singapore.
const question = 'Who can register for a NPO account?';
All local NPOs are welcome to join our platform. Do write in to partnerships@giftforgood.io if you are an NPO
that has not contacted us before.
const question = 'How should I report a post or user?';
Please write in to partnerships@giftforgood.io with a screenshot and we will reply within 3 working days.
Do you have any other questions?
